programme.title: Outlander
Outlander
programme.desc:
Outlander: Created by Ronald D. Moore. With Caitriona Balfe, Sam Heughan, Duncan Lacroix, Sophie Skelton. An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3006802/","name":"Outlander","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDVlYTg5NjYtZGRkYS00NjdhLWI4MWUtNmU3MGQ3MWI1MWE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3006802/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mcampbelljh1"},"dateCreated":"2014-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"An excellent adaptation of the books for all us Outlander fans!","reviewBody":"I've recently been reading (actually listening to the audio-books) the Outlander series of books having completed 5 so far so when I saw the Starz TV series was coming out I just had to watch it. I must say I loved the Outlander books, but I'm not a fanatic when it comes to translating books to the screen they are very different mediums and thus can take on a different look and feel and that's OK with me. In this case, I don't think people who are would be disappointed anyway as the screen writers did an excellent job of translating the 1st part of the book to the screen (I've only seen the 1st episode but I'm already hooked so I'm sure I'll enjoy the rest). 

I loved their choice of actors to take on the roles of Jamie, Claire, Frank and Dugan. Sam Heughan is perfect as Jamie Fraser (just the right bit of good looks and ruggedness one might expect in Jamie). Caitriona Balfe also seemed like a good choice for Claire (beautiful yet strong enough to carry the role). I think Frank/Jack Randall's portrayal by Tobias Menzies will also fit my vision of Frank/Jack and I think he can carry off both roles one as the wicked Jack and the other as the loving yet dull Frank (when compared to Jamie). And the Scottish actors like Graham McTavish (Dougal) will bring old Scotland to life on the screen for me. 

From the 1st episode I think they producers will not be shy to include the more sexual aspects of the Outlander books, as they do have this erotic element that actually makes the love between Claire and Jamie the driving force of their relationship which allows it to span centuries, even when they are no longer together. It's that love/passion for each other that keeps them alive in each other's heart and so far to the directors credit, they have not been shy about adding it. I'm looking forward to the Claire Jamie love scenes hopefully to come... I'm also going to enjoy the Scottish history and scenery, and loved the way they so far have included it in the TV series. It's going to be very interesting to me especially as my ancestors are Scottish.

I know Starz will be increasing its revenues with this series' fans all signing up just to see it. There must be millions of us around the world that love these books and I'm sure like me many of them will order the cable channel just to watch this. I'm very happy to see Starz did such a good job in bringing this to life on the screen. So rarely do we get a good adult drama on TV these days, and this will surely be that. I'm liking many of the original show Starz is offering this season like this and Black Sails, Strikback. Who ever is heading their creative development deserves a lot of credit for their selection of shows to produce. I think Starz is catching up to HBO and Showtime in it's original shows and might even surpass them if it keeps producing shows of this quality plus they have a much better selection of movies that the other channels. As a new Starz member, I'd recommend it to others.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140339,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2014-08-09","keywords":"scotland,scotsman,year 1743,scottish highlands,sex scene","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1495520/","name":"Caitriona Balfe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1537825/","name":"Sam Heughan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3795370/","name":"Duncan Lacroix"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0303436/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0410831/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0208971/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601822/","name":"Ronald D. Moore"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 6 Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3784950553","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjVhNmU2YTgtZjg2ZC00MDRmLWI1MTQtZjMwMmY3YmZjN2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjVhNmU2YTgtZjg2ZC00MDRmLWI1MTQtZjMwMmY3YmZjN2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743."}}</script><metacontent="

From the 1st episode I think they producers will not be shy to include the more sexual aspects of the Outlander books, as they do have this erotic element that actually makes the love between Claire and Jamie the driving force of their relationship which allows it to span centuries, even when they are no longer together. It's that love/passion for each other that keeps them alive in each other's heart and so far to the directors credit, they have not been shy about adding it. I'm looking forward to the Claire Jamie love scenes hopefully to come... I'm also going to enjoy the Scottish history and scenery, and loved the way they so far have included it in the TV series. It's going to be very interesting to me especially as my ancestors are Scottish.

I know Starz will be increasing its revenues with this series' fans all signing up just to see it. There must be millions of us around the world that love these books and I'm sure like me many of them will order the cable channel just to watch this. I'm very happy to see Starz did such a good job in bringing this to life on the screen. So rarely do we get a good adult drama on TV these days, and this will surely be that. I'm liking many of the original show Starz is offering this season like this and Black Sails, Strikback. Who ever is heading their creative development deserves a lot of credit for their selection of shows to produce. I think Starz is catching up to HBO and Showtime in it's original shows and might even surpass them if it keeps producing shows of this quality plus they have a much better selection of movies that the other channels. As a new Starz member, I'd recommend it to others.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140339,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2014-08-09","keywords":"scotland,scotsman,year 1743,scottish highlands,sex scene","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1495520/","name":"Caitriona Balfe","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1537825/","name":"Sam Heughan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3795370/","name":"Duncan Lacroix"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0303436/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0410831/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0208971/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601822/","name":"Ronald D. programme.title: The Night Shift: Turno da Noite
The Night Shift: Turno da Noite
Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.sub-title: Fais Ce Que Dois, Advienne Que Pourra
programme.desc:
Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2819924/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Doctor_Dexter"},"dateCreated":"2016-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The female sitcom-detective cliché","reviewBody":"Over the last decades, in Europe, we've been swamped with the older female detective character with a family in tow. Some have a weak excuse for a husband to emphasise their strength, many others are independent single mothers who struggle with a demanding job and raising their kids. To be honest, I'm not a fan of the genre. Nothing against strong and independent women, au contraire. I just prefer decent detective work above being sucked into the personal life of a fictional character. If I wanted to see family drama I'd go watch a sitcom. It's beyond me why the detective genre has to be muddled with sitcom-esque fluff like this. (I wouldn't buy it, but it's programmed on TV *instead* of a proper detective). I can accept a modest degree of family life. After all, Beck and Wallander have families too. However, they are primarily detectives, and every episode is about solving the case. 

"Candice Renoir" is more sitcom than detectives. And it's just as tacky and kitschy as the name already suggests. A fifty-something big mama, who seems to think she's Brigitte Bardot in the seventies, miraculously becomes the team leader of a small town detective team. She blunders through everything, but 'magically' finds clues in fashion magazines and the likes. She's supposed to portray the strong and independent older woman who can do it all, kids and playing the boss- detective, but it's way to contrived to be the least bit believable. Her character, the rainbow team, the younger cutesy neighbour - who has stamped "love interest" in all caps across his handsome forehead - it's all a stylised light version of a concept we've seen many, many times before. And now it's here again, only worse. Yay. 

To be fair, the acting of the team and other characters varies from passable to decent, but the lead actress is really milking the diva character, and as such, overacting horribly in just about every scene.

It might just about do as daytime TV, on a rainy afternoon, but that's probably me being generous.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1103,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-04-19","keywords":"france,female police officer,police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092291/","name":"Cécile Bois"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501845/","name":"Raphaël Lenglet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6511436/","name":"Clara Antoons"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011107/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053077/","name":"Robin Barataud"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043904/","name":"Brigitte Peskine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2784794/","name":"Solen Roy-Pagenault"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Promo Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2892283161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

I must say I loved the Outlander books, but I'm not a fanatic when it comes to translating books to the screen they are very different mediums and thus can take on a different look and feel and that's OK with me. In this case, I don't think people who are would be disappointed anyway as the screen writers did an excellent job of translating the 1st part of the book to the screen (I've only seen the 1st episode but I'm already hooked so I'm sure I'll enjoy the rest). 

I loved their choice of actors to take on the roles of Jamie, Claire, Frank and Dugan. Sam Heughan is perfect as Jamie Fraser (just the right bit of good looks and ruggedness one might expect in Jamie). Caitriona Balfe also seemed like a good choice for Claire (beautiful yet strong enough to carry the role). I think Frank/Jack Randall's portrayal by Tobias Menzies will also fit my vision of Frank/Jack and I think he can carry off both roles one as the wicked Jack and the other as the loving yet dull Frank (when compared to Jamie). And the Scottish actors like Graham McTavish (Dougal) will bring old Scotland to life on the screen for me. 

From the 1st episode I think they producers will not be shy to include the more sexual aspects of the Outlander books, as they do have this erotic element that actually makes the love between Claire and Jamie the driving force of their relationship which allows it to span centuries, even when they are no longer together. It's that love/passion for each other that keeps them alive in each other's heart and so far to the directors credit, they have not been shy about adding it. I'm looking forward to the Claire Jamie love scenes hopefully to come... I'm also going to enjoy the Scottish history and scenery, and loved the way they so far have included it in the TV series. It's going to be very interesting to me especially as my ancestors are Scottish.

I know Starz will be increasing its revenues with this series' fans all signing up just to see it. There must be millions of us around the world that love these books and I'm sure like me many of them will order the cable channel just to watch this. I'm very happy to see Starz did such a good job in bringing this to life on the screen. So rarely do we get a good adult drama on TV these days, and this will surely be that. I'm liking many of the original show Starz is offering this season like this and Black Sails, Strikback. Who ever is heading their creative development deserves a lot of credit for their selection of shows to produce. I think Starz is catching up to HBO and Showtime in it's original shows and might even surpass them if it keeps producing shows of this quality plus they have a much better selection of movies that the other channels. As a new Starz member, I'd recommend it to others.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140339,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2014-08-09","keywords":"scotland,scotsman,year 1743,scottish highlands,sex scene","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1495520/","name":"Caitriona Balfe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1537825/","name":"Sam Heughan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3795370/","name":"Duncan Lacroix"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0303436/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0410831/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0208971/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601822/","name":"Ronald D. IMDb data; ttnr: 3006802, Title: Outlander, --- Description: Outlander: Created by Ronald D. Moore. With Caitriona Balfe, Sam Heughan, Duncan Lacroix, Sophie Skelton. An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3006802/","name":"Outlander","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDVlYTg5NjYtZGRkYS00NjdhLWI4MWUtNmU3MGQ3MWI1MWE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3006802/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mcampbelljh1","dateCreated":"2014-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"An excellent adaptation of the books for all us Outlander fans!","reviewBody":"I've recently been reading (actually listening to the audio-books) the Outlander series of books having completed 5 so far so when I saw the Starz TV series was coming out I just had to watch it. I must say I loved the Outlander books, but I'm not a fanatic when it comes to translating books to the screen they are very different mediums and thus can take on a different look and feel and that's OK with me. In this case, I don't think people who are would be disappointed anyway as the screen writers did an excellent job of translating the 1st part of the book to the screen (I've only seen the 1st episode but I'm already hooked so I'm sure I'll enjoy the rest). 

I loved their choice of actors to take on the roles of Jamie, Claire, Frank and Dugan. Sam Heughan is perfect as Jamie Fraser (just the right bit of good looks and ruggedness one might expect in Jamie). Caitriona Balfe also seemed like a good choice for Claire (beautiful yet strong enough to carry the role). I think Frank/Jack Randall's portrayal by Tobias Menzies will also fit my vision of Frank/Jack and I think he can carry off both roles one as the wicked Jack and the other as the loving yet dull Frank (when compared to Jamie). And the Scottish actors like Graham McTavish (Dougal) will bring old Scotland to life on the screen for me. 

From the 1st episode I think they producers will not be shy to include the more sexual aspects of the Outlander books, as they do have this erotic element that actually makes the love between Claire and Jamie the driving force of their relationship which allows it to span centuries, even when they are no longer together. It's that love/passion for each other that keeps them alive in each other's heart and so far to the directors credit, they have not been shy about adding it. I'm looking forward to the Claire Jamie love scenes hopefully to come... I'm also going to enjoy the Scottish history and scenery, and loved the way they so far have included it in the TV series. It's going to be very interesting to me especially as my ancestors are Scottish.

I know Starz will be increasing its revenues with this series' fans all signing up just to see it. There must be millions of us around the world that love these books and I'm sure like me many of them will order the cable channel just to watch this. I'm very happy to see Starz did such a good job in bringing this to life on the screen. So rarely do we get a good adult drama on TV these days, and this will surely be that. I'm liking many of the original show Starz is offering this season like this and Black Sails, Strikback. Who ever is heading their creative development deserves a lot of credit for their selection of shows to produce. I think Starz is catching up to HBO and Showtime in it's original shows and might even surpass them if it keeps producing shows of this quality plus they have a much better selection of movies that the other channels. As a new Starz member, I'd recommend it to others.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140339,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2014-08-09","keywords":"scotland,scotsman,year 1743,scottish highlands,sex scene","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1495520/","name":"Caitriona Balfe","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1537825/","name":"Sam Heughan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3795370/","name":"Duncan Lacroix"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0303436/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0410831/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0208971/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601822/","name":"Ronald D. Moore"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 6 Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3784950553","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjVhNmU2YTgtZjg2ZC00MDRmLWI1MTQtZjMwMmY3YmZjN2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjVhNmU2YTgtZjg2ZC00MDRmLWI1MTQtZjMwMmY3YmZjN2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743."</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Metin Hüseyin, Stephen Woolfenden, Anna Foerster, Brian Kelly, Mike Barker

An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3006802/","name":"Outlander","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDVlYTg5NjYtZGRkYS00NjdhLWI4MWUtNmU3MGQ3MWI1MWE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3006802/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mcampbelljh1"},"dateCreated":"2014-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"An excellent adaptation of the books for all us Outlander fans!","reviewBody":"I've recently been reading (actually listening to the audio-books) the Outlander series of books having completed 5 so far so when I saw the Starz TV series was coming out I just had to watch it. I must say I loved the Outlander books, but I'm not a fanatic when it comes to translating books to the screen they are very different mediums and thus can take on a different look and feel and that's OK with me. In this case, I don't think people who are would be disappointed anyway as the screen writers did an excellent job of translating the 1st part of the book to the screen (I've only seen the 1st episode but I'm already hooked so I'm sure I'll enjoy the rest). 

I loved their choice of actors to take on the roles of Jamie, Claire, Frank and Dugan. Sam Heughan is perfect as Jamie Fraser (just the right bit of good looks and ruggedness one might expect in Jamie). Caitriona Balfe also seemed like a good choice for Claire (beautiful yet strong enough to carry the role). I think Frank/Jack Randall's portrayal by Tobias Menzies will also fit my vision of Frank/Jack and I think he can carry off both roles one as the wicked Jack and the other as the loving yet dull Frank (when compared to Jamie). And the Scottish actors like Graham McTavish (Dougal) will bring old Scotland to life on the screen for me. 

From the 1st episode I think they producers will not be shy to include the more sexual aspects of the Outlander books, as they do have this erotic element that actually makes the love between Claire and Jamie the driving force of their relationship which allows it to span centuries, even when they are no longer together. It's that love/passion for each other that keeps them alive in each other's heart and so far to the directors credit, they have not been shy about adding it. I'm looking forward to the Claire Jamie love scenes hopefully to come... I'm also going to enjoy the Scottish history and scenery, and loved the way they so far have included it in the TV series. It's going to be very interesting to me especially as my ancestors are Scottish.

I know Starz will be increasing its revenues with this series' fans all signing up just to see it. There must be millions of us around the world that love these books and I'm sure like me many of them will order the cable channel just to watch this. I'm very happy to see Starz did such a good job in bringing this to life on the screen. So rarely do we get a good adult drama on TV these days, and this will surely be that. I'm liking many of the original show Starz is offering this season like this and Black Sails, Strikback. Who ever is heading their creative development deserves a lot of credit for their selection of shows to produce. I think Starz is catching up to HBO and Showtime in it's original shows and might even surpass them if it keeps producing shows of this quality plus they have a much better selection of movies that the other channels. As a new Starz member, I'd recommend it to others.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140339,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2014-08-09","keywords":"scotland,scotsman,year 1743,scottish highlands,sex scene","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1495520/","name":"Caitriona Balfe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1537825/","name":"Sam Heughan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3795370/","name":"Duncan Lacroix"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0303436/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0410831/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0208971/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601822/","name":"Ronald D. I must say I loved the Outlander books, but I'm not a fanatic when it comes to translating books to the screen they are very different mediums and thus can take on a different look and feel and that's OK with me. In this case, I don't think people who are would be disappointed anyway as the screen writers did an excellent job of translating the 1st part of the book to the screen (I've only seen the 1st episode but I'm already hooked so I'm sure I'll enjoy the rest). 

I loved their choice of actors to take on the roles of Jamie, Claire, Frank and Dugan. Sam Heughan is perfect as Jamie Fraser (just the right bit of good looks and ruggedness one might expect in Jamie). Caitriona Balfe also seemed like a good choice for Claire (beautiful yet strong enough to carry the role). I think Frank/Jack Randall's portrayal by Tobias Menzies will also fit my vision of Frank/Jack and I think he can carry off both roles one as the wicked Jack and the other as the loving yet dull Frank (when compared to Jamie). And the Scottish actors like Graham McTavish (Dougal) will bring old Scotland to life on the screen for me. 

From the 1st episode I think they producers will not be shy to include the more sexual aspects of the Outlander books, as they do have this erotic element that actually makes the love between Claire and Jamie the driving force of their relationship which allows it to span centuries, even when they are no longer together. It's that love/passion for each other that keeps them alive in each other's heart and so far to the directors credit, they have not been shy about adding it. I'm looking forward to the Claire Jamie love scenes hopefully to come... I'm also going to enjoy the Scottish history and scenery, and loved the way they so far have included it in the TV series. It's going to be very interesting to me especially as my ancestors are Scottish.

I know Starz will be increasing its revenues with this series' fans all signing up just to see it. There must be millions of us around the world that love these books and I'm sure like me many of them will order the cable channel just to watch this. I'm very happy to see Starz did such a good job in bringing this to life on the screen. So rarely do we get a good adult drama on TV these days, and this will surely be that. I'm liking many of the original show Starz is offering this season like this and Black Sails, Strikback. Who ever is heading their creative development deserves a lot of credit for their selection of shows to produce. I think Starz is catching up to HBO and Showtime in it's original shows and might even surpass them if it keeps producing shows of this quality plus they have a much better selection of movies that the other channels. I loved their choice of actors to take on the roles of Jamie, Claire, Frank and Dugan. Caitriona Balfe also seemed like a good choice for Claire (beautiful yet strong enough to carry the role). I think Frank/Jack Randall's portrayal by Tobias Menzies will also fit my vision of Frank/Jack and I think he can carry off both roles one as the wicked Jack and the other as the loving yet dull Frank (when compared to Jamie). And the Scottish actors like Graham McTavish (Dougal) will bring old Scotland to life on the screen for me.

It's that love/passion for each other that keeps them alive in each other's heart and so far to the directors credit, they have not been shy about adding it. It's going to be very interesting to me especially as my ancestors are Scottish.

I know Starz will be increasing its revenues with this series' fans all signing up just to see it. IMDb data; ttnr: 3006802, Title: Outlander, --- Description: Outlander: Created by Ronald D. Moore. With Caitriona Balfe, Sam Heughan, Duncan Lacroix, Sophie Skelton. An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3006802/","name":"Outlander","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDVlYTg5NjYtZGRkYS00NjdhLWI4MWUtNmU3MGQ3MWI1MWE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3006802/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mcampbelljh1","dateCreated":"2014-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"An excellent adaptation of the books for all us Outlander fans!","reviewBody":"I've recently been reading (actually listening to the audio-books) the Outlander series of books having completed 5 so far so when I saw the Starz TV series was coming out I just had to watch it. I must say I loved the Outlander books, but I'm not a fanatic when it comes to translating books to the screen they are very different mediums and thus can take on a different look and feel and that's OK with me. In this case, I don't think people who are would be disappointed anyway as the screen writers did an excellent job of translating the 1st part of the book to the screen (I've only seen the 1st episode but I'm already hooked so I'm sure I'll enjoy the rest). 

I loved their choice of actors to take on the roles of Jamie, Claire, Frank and Dugan. Sam Heughan is perfect as Jamie Fraser (just the right bit of good looks and ruggedness one might expect in Jamie). Caitriona Balfe also seemed like a good choice for Claire (beautiful yet strong enough to carry the role). I think Frank/Jack Randall's portrayal by Tobias Menzies will also fit my vision of Frank/Jack and I think he can carry off both roles one as the wicked Jack and the other as the loving yet dull Frank (when compared to Jamie). And the Scottish actors like Graham McTavish (Dougal) will bring old Scotland to life on the screen for me. 

From the 1st episode I think they producers will not be shy to include the more sexual aspects of the Outlander books, as they do have this erotic element that actually makes the love between Claire and Jamie the driving force of their relationship which allows it to span centuries, even when they are no longer together. It's that love/passion for each other that keeps them alive in each other's heart and so far to the directors credit, they have not been shy about adding it. I'm looking forward to the Claire Jamie love scenes hopefully to come... I'm also going to enjoy the Scottish history and scenery, and loved the way they so far have included it in the TV series. It's going to be very interesting to me especially as my ancestors are Scottish.

I know Starz will be increasing its revenues with this series' fans all signing up just to see it. There must be millions of us around the world that love these books and I'm sure like me many of them will order the cable channel just to watch this. I'm very happy to see Starz did such a good job in bringing this to life on the screen. So rarely do we get a good adult drama on TV these days, and this will surely be that. I'm liking many of the original show Starz is offering this season like this and Black Sails, Strikback. Who ever is heading their creative development deserves a lot of credit for their selection of shows to produce. I think Starz is catching up to HBO and Showtime in it's original shows and might even surpass them if it keeps producing shows of this quality plus they have a much better selection of movies that the other channels. As a new Starz member, I'd recommend it to others.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140339,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2014-08-09","keywords":"scotland,scotsman,year 1743,scottish highlands,sex scene","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1495520/","name":"Caitriona Balfe","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1537825/","name":"Sam Heughan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3795370/","name":"Duncan Lacroix"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0303436/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0410831/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0208971/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601822/","name":"Ronald D. Moore"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 6 Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3784950553","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjVhNmU2YTgtZjg2ZC00MDRmLWI1MTQtZjMwMmY3YmZjN2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjVhNmU2YTgtZjg2ZC00MDRmLWI1MTQtZjMwMmY3YmZjN2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743."</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Metin Hüseyin, Stephen Woolfenden, Anna Foerster, Brian Kelly, Mike Barker

An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3006802/","name":"Outlander","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDVlYTg5NjYtZGRkYS00NjdhLWI4MWUtNmU3MGQ3MWI1MWE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3006802/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mcampbelljh1"},"dateCreated":"2014-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"An excellent adaptation of the books for all us Outlander fans!","reviewBody":"I've recently been reading (actually listening to the audio-books) the Outlander series of books having completed 5 so far so when I saw the Starz TV series was coming out I just had to watch it. I must say I loved the Outlander books, but I'm not a fanatic when it comes to translating books to the screen they are very different mediums and thus can take on a different look and feel and that's OK with me. In this case, I don't think people who are would be disappointed anyway as the screen writers did an excellent job of translating the 1st part of the book to the screen (I've only seen the 1st episode but I'm already hooked so I'm sure I'll enjoy the rest). 

I loved their choice of actors to take on the roles of Jamie, Claire, Frank and Dugan. Sam Heughan is perfect as Jamie Fraser (just the right bit of good looks and ruggedness one might expect in Jamie). Caitriona Balfe also seemed like a good choice for Claire (beautiful yet strong enough to carry the role). I think Frank/Jack Randall's portrayal by Tobias Menzies will also fit my vision of Frank/Jack and I think he can carry off both roles one as the wicked Jack and the other as the loving yet dull Frank (when compared to Jamie). And the Scottish actors like Graham McTavish (Dougal) will bring old Scotland to life on the screen for me. 

From the 1st episode I think they producers will not be shy to include the more sexual aspects of the Outlander books, as they do have this erotic element that actually makes the love between Claire and Jamie the driving force of their relationship which allows it to span centuries, even when they are no longer together. It's that love/passion for each other that keeps them alive in each other's heart and so far to the directors credit, they have not been shy about adding it. I'm looking forward to the Claire Jamie love scenes hopefully to come... I'm also going to enjoy the Scottish history and scenery, and loved the way they so far have included it in the TV series. It's going to be very interesting to me especially as my ancestors are Scottish.

I know Starz will be increasing its revenues with this series' fans all signing up just to see it. There must be millions of us around the world that love these books and I'm sure like me many of them will order the cable channel just to watch this. I'm very happy to see Starz did such a good job in bringing this to life on the screen. So rarely do we get a good adult drama on TV these days, and this will surely be that. I'm liking many of the original show Starz is offering this season like this and Black Sails, Strikback. Who ever is heading their creative development deserves a lot of credit for their selection of shows to produce. I think Starz is catching up to HBO and Showtime in it's original shows and might even surpass them if it keeps producing shows of this quality plus they have a much better selection of movies that the other channels. As a new Starz member, I'd recommend it to others.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140339,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2014-08-09","keywords":"scotland,scotsman,year 1743,scottish highlands,sex scene","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1495520/","name":"Caitriona Balfe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1537825/","name":"Sam Heughan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3795370/","name":"Duncan Lacroix"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0303436/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0410831/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0208971/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601822/","name":"Ronald D. programme.title: 28 Dias
programme.desc: Gwen Cummings, uma jornalista de Nova Iorque, vive para se divertir, ultrapassando todos os limites. É bonita e bem-sucedida, mas tem problemas com o álcool. Quando foge com a limusina do casamento da irmã e bate numa varanda, é condenada pelo tribunal a passar 28 dias numa clínica de reabilitação.

programme.title: Hailey Dean Mysteries: Sede de Matar
programme.desc: Quinze anos depois do assassinato do noivo, Hailey Dean trabalha com o irmão dele, o detetive Danny Morgan, com o detetive Fincher e o colega de faculdade Clyde para finalmente resolver o caso.

programme.title: Hailey Dean Mysteries: Morte em Serviço
programme.desc: Hailey Dean ajuda o melhor amigo e investigador do Ministério Público, Fincher Garland, a lidar com o homicídio inesperado de um amigo, Kurt Cullen, com quem serviu nos Marines.

programme.title: Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.sub-title: Il N'y a Pas de Grenouille qui ne Trouve son Crapaud - Partie 1
programme.desc:
Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2819924/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Doctor_Dexter"},"dateCreated":"2016-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The female sitcom-detective cliché","reviewBody":"Over the last decades, in Europe, we've been swamped with the older female detective character with a family in tow. Some have a weak excuse for a husband to emphasise their strength, many others are independent single mothers who struggle with a demanding job and raising their kids. To be honest, I'm not a fan of the genre. Nothing against strong and independent women, au contraire. I just prefer decent detective work above being sucked into the personal life of a fictional character. If I wanted to see family drama I'd go watch a sitcom. It's beyond me why the detective genre has to be muddled with sitcom-esque fluff like this. (I wouldn't buy it, but it's programmed on TV *instead* of a proper detective). I can accept a modest degree of family life. After all, Beck and Wallander have families too. However, they are primarily detectives, and every episode is about solving the case. 

"Candice Renoir" is more sitcom than detectives. And it's just as tacky and kitschy as the name already suggests. A fifty-something big mama, who seems to think she's Brigitte Bardot in the seventies, miraculously becomes the team leader of a small town detective team. She blunders through everything, but 'magically' finds clues in fashion magazines and the likes. She's supposed to portray the strong and independent older woman who can do it all, kids and playing the boss- detective, but it's way to contrived to be the least bit believable. Her character, the rainbow team, the younger cutesy neighbour - who has stamped "love interest" in all caps across his handsome forehead - it's all a stylised light version of a concept we've seen many, many times before. And now it's here again, only worse. Yay. 

To be fair, the acting of the team and other characters varies from passable to decent, but the lead actress is really milking the diva character, and as such, overacting horribly in just about every scene.

It might just about do as daytime TV, on a rainy afternoon, but that's probably me being generous.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1103,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-04-19","keywords":"france,female police officer,police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092291/","name":"Cécile Bois"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501845/","name":"Raphaël Lenglet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6511436/","name":"Clara Antoons"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011107/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053077/","name":"Robin Barataud"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043904/","name":"Brigitte Peskine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2784794/","name":"Solen Roy-Pagenault"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Promo Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2892283161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

I can accept a modest degree of family life. After all, Beck and Wallander have families too. However, they are primarily detectives, and every episode is about solving the case. 

"Candice Renoir" is more sitcom than detectives. And it's just as tacky and kitschy as the name already suggests. A fifty-something big mama, who seems to think she's Brigitte Bardot in the seventies, miraculously becomes the team leader of a small town detective team. She blunders through everything, but 'magically' finds clues in fashion magazines and the likes. She's supposed to portray the strong and independent older woman who can do it all, kids and playing the boss- detective, but it's way to contrived to be the least bit believable. Her character, the rainbow team, the younger cutesy neighbour - who has stamped "love interest" in all caps across his handsome forehead - it's all a stylised light version of a concept we've seen many, many times before. And now it's here again, only worse. Yay. 

To be fair, the acting of the team and other characters varies from passable to decent, but the lead actress is really milking the diva character, and as such, overacting horribly in just about every scene.

It might just about do as daytime TV, on a rainy afternoon, but that's probably me being generous.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1103,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-04-19","keywords":"france,female police officer,police","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092291/","name":"Cécile Bois","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501845/","name":"Raphaël Lenglet","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6511436/","name":"Clara Antoons"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011107/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053077/","name":"Robin Barataud","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043904/","name":"Brigitte Peskine","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2784794/","name":"Solen Roy-Pagenault"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Promo Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2892283161","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Pascal Lahmani, Nicolas Picard-Dreyfuss, Stéphane Malhuret, Olivier Barma, Raphaël Lenglet

programme.title: Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.sub-title: Il N'y a Pas de Grenouille qui ne Trouve son Crapaud - Partie 2
programme.desc:
Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2819924/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Doctor_Dexter"},"dateCreated":"2016-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The female sitcom-detective cliché","reviewBody":"Over the last decades, in Europe, we've been swamped with the older female detective character with a family in tow. Some have a weak excuse for a husband to emphasise their strength, many others are independent single mothers who struggle with a demanding job and raising their kids. To be honest, I'm not a fan of the genre. Nothing against strong and independent women, au contraire. I just prefer decent detective work above being sucked into the personal life of a fictional character. If I wanted to see family drama I'd go watch a sitcom. It's beyond me why the detective genre has to be muddled with sitcom-esque fluff like this. (I wouldn't buy it, but it's programmed on TV *instead* of a proper detective). I can accept a modest degree of family life. After all, Beck and Wallander have families too. However, they are primarily detectives, and every episode is about solving the case. 

"Candice Renoir" is more sitcom than detectives. And it's just as tacky and kitschy as the name already suggests. A fifty-something big mama, who seems to think she's Brigitte Bardot in the seventies, miraculously becomes the team leader of a small town detective team. She blunders through everything, but 'magically' finds clues in fashion magazines and the likes. She's supposed to portray the strong and independent older woman who can do it all, kids and playing the boss- detective, but it's way to contrived to be the least bit believable. Her character, the rainbow team, the younger cutesy neighbour - who has stamped "love interest" in all caps across his handsome forehead - it's all a stylised light version of a concept we've seen many, many times before. And now it's here again, only worse. Yay. 

To be fair, the acting of the team and other characters varies from passable to decent, but the lead actress is really milking the diva character, and as such, overacting horribly in just about every scene.

It might just about do as daytime TV, on a rainy afternoon, but that's probably me being generous.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1103,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-04-19","keywords":"france,female police officer,police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092291/","name":"Cécile Bois"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501845/","name":"Raphaël Lenglet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6511436/","name":"Clara Antoons"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011107/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053077/","name":"Robin Barataud"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043904/","name":"Brigitte Peskine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2784794/","name":"Solen Roy-Pagenault"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Promo Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2892283161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Maggie Tem um Plano
programme.desc: Maggie apaixona-se por um homem casado, que se divorcia para ficar com ela. Passados três anos, Maggie deixa de ver sentido na relação e encontra-se numa encruzilhada: o que fazer quando se descobre que o nosso namorado e a ex-mulher são o par perfeito?

programme.title: A Viagem de Despedida
programme.desc: Uma família lida com a morte da irmã e viaja pelo país para recolher os seus pertences e juntar as memórias que têm da mulher que perderam.

programme.title: Million Dollar Baby - Sonhos Vencidos
programme.desc: Frankie Dunn foi agente e treinador dos melhores pugilistas, numa vida passada nos ringues de boxe. Na sequência do doloroso afastamento da sua filha, Frankie revela uma já longa dificuldade na aproximação aos outros. Já Maggie sabe bem o que quer e tem a determinação necessária para o alcançar.

programme.title: O Bairro da Máfia
programme.desc: Após um período no exército, onde participou na Operação Tempestade no Deserto, Tommy, o filho de um mafioso de Filadélfia, é forçado por um agente do FBI a infiltrar-se no negócio da família para provar que a máfia siciliana está a tentar dominar o tráfico de heroína nos EUA.

programme.title: Plano B
programme.desc: Quando o agente dos serviços secretos Vic Davis vai buscar o filho à universidade, percebe que há um rapto prestes a acontecer. A vítima é uma colega do rapaz, filha de um juiz do Supremo Tribunal, e os malfeitores não vão parar até a terem para usá-la como vantagem negocial.

programme.title: Presa Implacável
programme.desc: O capitão Matt Hendricks e Linda Christian encontram-se presos num submarino com terroristas russos que ameaçam lançar um vírus letal no território americano.

programme.title: Nós Que Ficámos
programme.desc: A vida pacata de Cami e da sua filha adolescente é virada do avesso com o falecimento repentino do pai da rapariga, cuja nova mulher e filha pequena ficam de repente sem lar nem rendimentos. Cami acolhe-as em sua casa, mas não vai ser fácil juntar aquelas quatro figuras debaixo do mesmo teto.

programme.title: Filadélfia
programme.desc: Aparentemente com uma carreira de sucesso pela frente, Andrew Beckett é despedido da firma de advogados onde trabalha quando descobrem que está infetado com o vírus da SIDA. O advogado contrata então os serviços de Joe Miller, acusando a firma de o ter despedido apenas por discriminação.

programme.title: Assalto de Risco
programme.desc: Crunch Calhoun, um motoqueiro ladrão de arte, é preso depois de ser traído por Nick, seu irmão e parceiro no crime. Quando deixa a cadeia, Crunch concorda em reunir o seu velho gangue para levarem a cabo um último e audacioso golpe: roubar os livros mais valiosos do mundo.

programme.title: A Arte da Guerra: Traição
programme.desc: Reformado ao fim de uma carreira irrepreensível, o agente Neil Shaw vê-se subitamente envolvido num estranho e secreto plano para assassinar vários senadores.

programme.title: Dupla Sedução
programme.desc: Claire é ex-agente da CIA. Ray é ex-agente da MI6. Ambos trocaram a espionagem governamental pelo lucrativo mundo dos negócios, onde reina uma terrível "Guerra Fria" entre duas multinacionais rivais. Agora, a missão é obter a fórmula de um produto que trará fortuna à empresa que o patentear.

programme.title: Evereste
programme.desc: Inspirado na história verídica de uma expedição ao cume do Evereste, que terminou em tragédia. Os alpinistas foram apanhados de surpresa por uma violenta tempestade de neve.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Os Crawleys e os funcionários preparam-se para o momento mais alto das suas vidas: uma visita do rei e da rainha de Inglaterra. Uma adaptação para cinema da série fenómeno "Downton Abbey".

programme.title: Sete Anos no Tibete
programme.desc: Heinrich Harrer, um alpinista austríaco, tenta, em 1939, subir os Himalaias e trava conhecimento com o jovem Dalai Lama. Ele e o seu companheiro Peter são os únicos dois estrangeiros a pisar a cidade sagrada de Lhasa. Esta viagem leva-os a testemunhar um momento marcante da história do Tibete.

programme.title: Drácula de Bram Stoker
programme.desc: Neste remake da clássica história, o príncipe da Transilvânia, no século XIX, viaja até Londres em busca de amor humano. Depois de viver sozinho durante anos, o desejo de Drácula por algo humano transforma-se no seu maior propósito. Em Londres, este encontra Mina, uma sósia da sua falecida mulher.

programme.title: Instinto Fatal
programme.desc: Johnny Boz, uma antiga estrela rock e proprietário de clubes noturnos, é encontrado morto na sua cama, assassinado com um picador de gelo. O caso é entregue ao toxicómano em recuperação Nick Curran, sendo que a namorada Catherine Tramell é a principal suspeita.

programme.title: Estranha Escuridão
programme.desc: Três melhores amigas seguem em viagem para um concerto de heavy metal, onde fazem amizade com aspirantes a músicos. No final, acabam por ir todos juntos para a casa de campo de uma delas, para uma festa que se revelará mortal.

programme.title: Sorte Malvada
programme.desc: Dois irmãos irlandeses devem dinheiro a um mafioso mas quando chegam a acordo sobre a forma de pagar a dívida, tudo dá para o torto e eles veem-se forçados a proteger uma adolescente em perigo ao mesmo tempo que são perseguidos por assassinos contratados.

programme.title: Silver - A Lenda do Cavalo Prateado
programme.desc: Uma mãe conta à filha uma fábula sobre o príncipe dos cavalos selvagens da Austrália, que tem de encontrar o seu lugar entre os outros equídeos e ao mesmo tempo proteger-se do homem que assumiu por missão capturá-lo e domá-lo.

programme.title: Smurfs: A Aldeia Perdida (V.P.)
programme.desc: Os Smurfs regressam numa aventura totalmente animada! Um misterioso mapa leva Smurfina e os seus melhores amigos Sabichão, Trapalhão e Valentão numa emocionante aventura pela Floresta Proibida, para encontrar uma misteriosa aldeia perdida.

programme.title: Evereste
programme.desc: Inspirado na história verídica de uma expedição ao cume do Evereste, que terminou em tragédia. Os alpinistas foram apanhados de surpresa por uma violenta tempestade de neve.

programme.title: Águas Perigosas
programme.desc: Nancy está sozinha numa praia isolada a fazer surf. Atacada por um tubarão, refugia-se num rochedo, a 200 metros da costa. Para salvar-se, terá de recorrer a todos os seus recursos e vontade, para ultrapassar o enorme tubarão branco.

programme.title: A Máscara de Zorro
programme.desc: Passaram mais de 20 anos desde que Don Diego de la Vega lutou com sucesso contra a opressão espanhola, com o lendário e romântico nome de Zorro. Preso durante duas décadas, tem agora de encontrar um sucessor para travar Don Rafael Montero, que regressou ao território com um louco projeto na manga.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim Contra o Mundo
programme.desc: Scott Pilgrim é um rapaz de 22 anos que toca numa banda. Ele acaba de conhecer a rapariga dos seus sonhos, Ramona Flowers. O único entrave para ganhar o seu coração? Os sete maléficos ex-namorados preparados para o matar, que terá de enfrentar.

programme.title: Palpitações
programme.desc: Numa pequena povoação norte-americana, próxima de um deserto, há estranhos tremores que assustam a população. Ironicamente chamada Perfection (perfeição, em português), a cidade tem por baixo de si vermes famintos por humanos... que se movem a grande velocidade.

programme.title: Instinto Fatal
programme.desc: Johnny Boz, uma antiga estrela rock e proprietário de clubes noturnos, é encontrado morto na sua cama, assassinado com um picador de gelo. O caso é entregue ao toxicómano em recuperação Nick Curran, sendo que a namorada Catherine Tramell é a principal suspeita.

programme.title: Riddick - A Ascensão
programme.desc: Traído pela sua própria raça e deixado para morrer num planeta isolado, Riddick luta para sobreviver num ambiente hostil repleto de predadores alienígenas e caçadores de toda a galáxia.

programme.title: Colateral
programme.desc: Max tem uma longa experiência como taxista e está curado de sustos. Até que, numa noite, tem como passageiro um assassino com uma missão em mãos. Vincent faz do taxista refém, à medida que se move pela noite de Los Angeles com cinco paragens em vista... e cinco pessoas para matar.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
CSI: Crime Sob Investigação
programme.desc: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation: Created by Anthony E. Zuiker. With George Eads, Eric Szmanda, Robert David Hall, Paul Guilfoyle. programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
Investigação Criminal: New Orleans
programme.desc:
NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
Investigação Criminal: New Orleans
programme.desc:
NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shaypack"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Change the name to CSI: Vogue","reviewBody":"One person ruins this show: David Caruso. All he does is pose. They should make it into a drinking game. Every time he strikes a pose, take a shot. Of course, people have died from alcohol poisoning. This would only add to the statistics. All the other characters have depth. He just gets this look on his face and 'strikes a pose'. Watch him turn sideways and look over his shoulder. Wow!! OOOhhh, he figured out something. Time for him to take off his sunglasses. I challenge any of you to find an episode where he isn't positioned sideways looking over his shoulder and where he takes off his sunglasses. Quit posing and pretend like you know how to act!!!!\n\nAnd, how come he has to figure everything out? The other shows let the other characters show some brains. How 'bout letting the other CSI Vogue characters have a little spotlight?"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55488,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. CSI: Miami
programme.desc: CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shaypack"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Change the name to CSI: Vogue","reviewBody":"One person ruins this show: David Caruso. All he does is pose. They should make it into a drinking game. Every time he strikes a pose, take a shot. Of course, people have died from alcohol poisoning. This would only add to the statistics. All the other characters have depth. He just gets this look on his face and 'strikes a pose'. Watch him turn sideways and look over his shoulder. Wow!! OOOhhh, he figured out something. Time for him to take off his sunglasses. I challenge any of you to find an episode where he isn't positioned sideways looking over his shoulder and where he takes off his sunglasses. Quit posing and pretend like you know how to act!!!!\n\nAnd, how come he has to figure everything out? The other shows let the other characters show some brains. How 'bout letting the other CSI Vogue characters have a little spotlight?"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55488,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. An ex-Navy SEAL returns from Afghanistan and uses his military skills to become a private investigator in Hawaii." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7942796/","name":"Magnum P.I.","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzMzMGZjYjktNzNiMi00MDEyLWEyYzAtOWJmZTY1NGUyNTkzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjYwNDA2MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ex-Navy SEAL returns from Afghanistan and uses his military skills to become a private investigator in Hawaii.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7942796/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tinglis-90618"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Magnum with his own style","reviewBody":"We couldn't image anyone other than Tom Selleck being Magnum; however, Jay Hernandez puts his own spin on the character with his own charming style. programme.title: Hansel & Gretel: Caçadores de Bruxas
programme.desc: Depois de terem ganho o gosto à caça às bruxas, ainda em crianças, Hansel e Gretel tornam-se grandes vigilantes, determinados a retaliar. Mas, sem saberem, os dois irmãos passam a ser o alvo e terão de enfrentar um mal ainda maior: o passado.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
CSI: Miami
programme.desc: CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shaypack"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Change the name to CSI: Vogue","reviewBody":"One person ruins this show: David Caruso. All he does is pose. They should make it into a drinking game. Every time he strikes a pose, take a shot. Of course, people have died from alcohol poisoning. This would only add to the statistics. All the other characters have depth. He just gets this look on his face and 'strikes a pose'. Watch him turn sideways and look over his shoulder. Wow!! OOOhhh, he figured out something. Time for him to take off his sunglasses. I challenge any of you to find an episode where he isn't positioned sideways looking over his shoulder and where he takes off his sunglasses. Quit posing and pretend like you know how to act!!!!\n\nAnd, how come he has to figure everything out? The other shows let the other characters show some brains. How 'bout letting the other CSI Vogue characters have a little spotlight?"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55488,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E.
